intro: Cyanea blinii, commonly known as the Blini's cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Cyanea blinii typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to salty air and sandy soils. It plays an important role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
